author: raz
title: Blockchaintranslation.io Part3:BLOG
description: Marketing & Criação de conteúdo educacional/notural de qualidade são caros. Maximização do conteúdo e exposição a múltiplas plataformas = melhor ROI possível

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely that Marketing & Creating quality educational/news content are expensive. It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by creating Language Community Hubs with Publishing content on YouTube, TikTok & SoundCloud + Edu & news blog.
This proposal shows somewhat how it adds value to the Cardano system by creating Language Community Hubs. Publishing on YouTube, TikTok & SoundCloud + Educational content and news. Key metrics are  stated such as number of videos, blog posts, educational articles, news articles, podcasts.  The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge. Proposal can scale to address future challenges by further adding more content and more platforms. This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the awareness and knowledge among various language speakers.  I can say that this project adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 4 star rating.
 
If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers have provided no evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in content creation, video creation, translation or these sort of projects. They have already received funding in two previous proposals. No Linkedin profiles are given here. Ideally they should have been provided, together with work done in previous funds. If F6 work has been done, to an extent perhaps those could be shown. The links are not sufficient.   I feel the proposer is competent to do the blog.The proposal   has  indicated the core leadership. The Linkedin profiles are not given.  He has not provided the team structure of members and their capabilities  The budget has  been outlined clearly   Also the price is reasonable considering what the output is.The budget is   reasonable to achieve the set goals.The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required .  There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. Theres a detailed timetable  which is reasonable, but its not realistic to consider 6 new languages within 3 months if its a lot of content.The proposal gives a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed. The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal.  This proposal may  be implemented successfully and budget is reasonable though in some places hazy,  hence I have given it a 3 star rating.   
 A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement . The Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal would be number of videos and how many views per video and in total, number of blog articles, news articles, educational articles, soundcloud audio files, number of languages published. A marketing budget has been allocated. But they have specified that marketing will come later. 
It is not clear when they talk about translations as 60 USD per European translation and 120 USD per African/Asian translation.  What is it that they are translating? Is it one blog post, or 10 blog posts or the entire site?  This clarity is critical.  So on this basis the budget is hazy in my professional opinion as someone who has been doing translation and content creation for about 20 years.There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem 
and there is a detailed solution. The proposer has not identified some possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties such as translation of technical terms.The information provided is  sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a 4 star rating.
Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal sets to encourage not engglish speaking users to learn about and adopt cardano by providing them with educational materials in their native language. This will help market the value and drive adoption for non english speakers in the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Rik has sufficient experience as well as prior funded proposals. This proposal is the fund the end stage of his project that is already in the works which gives confidence to the successful implementation of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget breakdown is good, but would be helped by showing any more detal that is possible. The KPI's are desirable as it has measures the impact of the proposal in the quantity of material but also the number of languages supported.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem raised by this proposal is clear and related to the criteria of the challenge in that its solution aims at creating Language Community Hubs. Perhaps it is my lack of marketing knowledge that prevents me from really considering the impact of this solution on the Catalyst ecosystem, but more clear information on this subject would have strengthened this project and demonstrated the importance the team places on it. However, the overall positive impact is  explained and is evidenced by the indices provided in the KPIs, which could have been explained a bit more too, to be understandable for all.
f6_assessments.q1: A little more precision on the members of the team would have been important, it is true that it is specified that they are members of the community, but is it enough to have a precise idea of the members to whom the community can refer? The website is given, but unless I am mistaken, does not bring more information on the members of the team. The budget is detailed and broken down into different items. It seems realistic. The fact that it is stated that this project has already been founded in F6 is rather positive, providing evidence of results, links or other would have been a plus to attest to the success of these early implementation phases. Risks are not addressed either, which would have indicated the ways in which the team has responded to them.
f6_assessments.q2:
Overall, this proposal lacks a clear explanation of how they will communicate their progress to the Catalyst community. Providing a roadmap with a precise plan would have been more transparent and would have made it easier to understand the development of the project.On the other hand, annex documents are provided.
But on the whole, more explanations would have helped to accentuate the auditability of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is the part 3 of the series blockchaintranslation.io in which will create news/social platform for the first two parts: Translator Collaboration Platform, and Commercial Platform for Blockchain Translation Service for LangBassadors - are both very good and have been funded. I strongly agree that this proposal addresses the challenge since it bring multi-language news and educational blog translated in 20 languages for the Cardano community internationally.
f6_assessments.q1: I rate 5 for feasibility of this proposal. Timeline, budget and development planning are clear and compatible. Since the proposer doesn't list the team of translators, programmers and video editors, I assume they are using the team in previous fund. However, I think the proposer should add information about the team again on this proposal so that it could be more completed and persuasive.
f6_assessments.q2:
Since it is the social/news platform, it has two ways of communication:  news release and audience engagement. The latter part has been mentioned to KPIs of this proposal, so I suggest team to estimate and add more figures about people reach out to Youtube, SoundCloud and Tiktok. 
Roadmap with milestone is clear. I agree this proposal provides me sufficient information to assess its progress and audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a great proposal. Blockchaintranslation.io consists of 3 seperate parts, the previous two of which were funded in Fund6 (Translator Collaboration Platform, Commercial Platform for Blockchain Translation Service for LangBassadors). This section is Multi Language News & Educational Blog, the animation videos ( of which 8 are funded thanks to our F5 : ADA News in African Languages in the Grow Africa Grow Cardano challenge ) can be published, together with other articles + podcast scripts; All available in as many languages as possible.
This will help people around the world, especially those who don't speak English, can access Blockchain as well as the Cardano ecosystem in their own language, removing the language barrier.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the team has sufficient evidence to demonstrate the skills and experience needed to implement the proposal, it would be interesting to know the profile of the people involved. It is also important to have more detail regarding the number of people involved, estimate hours and allocated budget to the different work packages for project implementation.
I have read the offer and visited the website, the proposers have provided a pretty detailed roadmap/criteria for success. However, there should be more goals such as: number of users accessing, number of views, number of downloads, ...
The budget allocation part needs to be further (determining the number of participants, the number of working hours, the amount paid per hour,...). "Aim is 10 European Languages +10 African/Asian languages" - What are those languages specifically?
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided is enough for people to evaluate progress, success. However, it is necessary to increase the persuasion by adding some of the information mentioned in the previous section (profiles of relevant people, adding success evaluation criteria, ...)
This is a project with potential, I believe it will bring positive value to the Cardano ecosystem.
